escalate: ESC retroactive discount/price adjustment inquiries immediately
ESC if stylists/salons want to carry the products
templates: For any q's about affiliate links, commissions, or salon referral links, use AFQ shortcut
All of the products are unisex, use USX shortcut
drive_to_purchase: Ask the cx what their hair concerns are before making a recommendation!
Make recommendations when cx has specific inquiry, don't send the quiz!
For full haircare regimen inquiries, recommend shampoo, conditioner, and at least one or two other products recommended that align with their need
promo_and_promo_exclusions: When sending a code provide more detail about what the code is valid for!
When sending the promo/code end date, include the time the offer expires as well!

Wooden Ships: I'm sorry to hear that and for the delay in replying. Have you encountered any error messages? Also, could you kindly share a screenshot of the items in your cart? I'll be happy to look into the issue!

For the Heart Back Chunky Cardi Cotton, your feedback means a lot to us and helps us keep improving. I truly appreciate you sharing this, and I'll be sure to pass it along to our team for future consideration.

important: The client wants us to sound as ONE person
âžœ  Do NOT mention that you're reaching out to the team, you haven't heard back from the team, or any reference to the team or another team - we should sound as one person
send_to_cs: Send to CS if cx sends photos of items from the website or if photos/screenshots are not coming through
escalate: Go the extra mile for cx's - ESC any q's you're unsure of
When ESC on weekdays, use ESC shortcut
When ESC on weekends, use WKD shortcut
ESC if a cx doesn't want to sign the package / provide a signature when receiving their order
ESC if a cx wants to know when an item will be available/back in stock
ESC if a cx wants to know where an item is shipped from
ESC immediately if a cx has an issue applying a code that we didn't share (it's not in the UI or website)
templates: If a cx is asking for updates after we've escalated - use DUP shortcut. Don't tell the cx, you haven't heard back
If a cx shares an incorrect response to the Journey asking them to share their birthday month - use BRE shortcut
tone: Do not take responsibility and directly apologize when the issue is not caused by the brand and all systems are functioning as intended
If the client takes over, do NOT send a message before 5 PM EST on the day the client responded
âžœ If 5PM, or a day has passed we should reply
If the convo is escalated, do NOT send a message before 5 PM EST on the day it was escalated
âžœ  If 5PM, or a day has passed we should reply
drive_to_purchase: Don't tell cx's we'll restock an item which is not available on the website
dos_and_don_ts: Do not say that "my system is limited", limited access" or similar phrases
Do not say "I don't have better deals", "I don't have any codes available", or similar phrases
Do not say "sales collection", say "sale collection"
promo_and_promo_exclusions: We have a brand-specific CWW template
If a cx shows any purchase intent, always share our code.
âžœ Asks when an item will go on sale
âžœ Responds to the browsing/cart abandonment journey, showing interest
If cx asks for a percentage code, share 10WELCOME code for 10% off
Cx's can use a code and receive free shipping as well

Fazoli's: Hey, this is Jordan from Fazoli's. Thanks for checking out our online ordering site! https://fazolis.attn.tv/a8gNHN_ZEPgv 

Are there any questions I can answer for you?
why is baked fettuccini alfredo $5 but regular fettuccini alfredo is $10? Is the baked version much smaller or?

Fazoli's: Great question! The baked fettuccini alfredo is served as a smaller portion and offered as part of our value menu, which is why it's priced lower at $5. The regular fettuccini alfredo is a full-size entrÃ©e, which comes with a larger portion and is priced at $10. Both are delicious, but the baked version is designed as a lighter option.
